briefTitle: Breath Analysis Technique to Diagnose Pulmonary Embolism
officialTitle: Expired CO2/O2 Analysis to Diagnose Pulmonary Embolism
summary: A pulmonary embolism (PE) is a blockage in one of the arteries of the lungs, and is usually caused by a traveling blood clot. The D-dimer blood test is currently used to diagnose PEs, but it is not always accurate for individuals who have recently undergone surgery or who have inflammatory-provoking diseases. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effectiveness of the Carboximeter, a new PE diagnostic device that measures carbon dioxide (CO2) and oxygen (O2) output, in individuals at risk for developing PEs.

primaryOutcome.measure: Phase I: Percentage Change in the Postoperative End Tidal CO2/O2 Ratio and D-dimer Concentration Relative to the Preoperative Measurement
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Pre-op measurement: the morning of surgery. Post-op measurement: the latter of postoperative day 3 or hospital discharge
